New Records: Virat Kohli has already made 711 runs, breaking Sachin Tendulkar's record for the most at a World Cup with a game to spare.
Virat Kohli now has 50 ODI centuries to his name.
Mohammed Shami is the top wicket taker at the tournament as it stands, despite only playing six matches.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predict India as the favorites given their home advantage and dominant performance throughout the tournament.
The key battle will come at the top of the order - the likes of Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood must stop Rohit Sharma, Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli from getting off to a flyer.
Australia's task is to silence the crowd and get some nerves jangling, as the Black Caps were able to do to a degree in their semi-final clash before falling short.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will take place at Ahmedabad's huge Narendra Modi Stadium, which holds 132,000 spectators.
Australia have won the majority of the 150 ODI matches between the two teams, but India have come out on top in three of the four games played in the past two months.
